CODEX CHRONOLOGY ATLAS TOOLS

Solstice War

Codex information
This page is a work in progress. Information about this topic may be incomplete.

The Solstice War (the Chorale War, or the Terran Civil War) was a Terran conflict that lasted from 12E 368 to 12E 507. The war followed the banning of competing parties from the Terran Union parliament, and ultimately ended with its dissolution, with Terran space fracturing into multiple warring factions for well over a century, until the capture of Geneva in 507 and the subsequent formation of the modern Terran Federation.

Background

First contact and the following First Exchange with the Ikamo led to the successful development of the quantum drive, a faster-than-light transportation system that allowed spacecraft to travel much faster than those equipped with an older warp drive system. The discovery of abundant antimatter in hyperspace also sparked a gold rush from Terran corporations as well as the then-Terran government, the Terran Union.

Private corporations quickly began aggressively pushing development of hyperspace travel and antimatter trawling technologies, while simultaneously receiving financial incentives from the Terran Union for their continued expansion into space and development of antimatter trawling and quantum drive technology.
